Specification Class
===
> Determine the specification defined classification of an object.

<!-- <usage> -->
## Usage

``` javascript
var specificationClass = require( '@stdlib/utils/specification-class' );
```

#### specificationClass( value )

Returns a `string` value indicating a [specification defined][object-to-string] classification of an `object`.

``` javascript
var str = specificationClass( 'a' );
// returns '[object String]'

str = specificationClass( 5 );
// returns '[object Number]'

function Beep(){}
str = specificationClass( new Beep() );
// returns '[object Object]'
```
<!-- </usage> -->

<!-- <examples> -->
## Examples

``` javascript
var specificationClass = require( '@stdlib/utils/specification-class' );

console.log( specificationClass( 'a' ) );
// returns '[object String]'

console.log( specificationClass( 5 ) );
// returns '[object Number]'

console.log( specificationClass( NaN ) );
// returns '[object Number]'

console.log( specificationClass( null ) );
// returns '[object Null]'

console.log( specificationClass( undefined ) );
// returns '[object Undefined]'

console.log( specificationClass( true ) );
// returns '[object Boolean]'

console.log( specificationClass( false ) );
// returns '[object Boolean]'

console.log( specificationClass( {} ) );
// returns '[object Object]'

console.log( specificationClass( [] ) );
// returns '[object Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( function noop(){} ) );
// returns '[object Function]'

console.log( specificationClass( /./ ) );
// returns '[object RegExp]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Date() ) );
// returns '[object Date]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Map() ) );
// returns '[object Map]'

console.log( specificationClass( new WeakMap() ) );
// returns '[object WeakMap]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Set() ) );
// returns '[object Set]'

console.log( specificationClass( new WeakSet() ) );
// returns '[object WeakSet]'

console.log( specificationClass( Symbol() ) );
// returns '[object Symbol]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Error() ) );
// returns '[object Error]'

console.log( specificationClass( new TypeError() ) );
// returns '[object Error]'

console.log( specificationClass( new SyntaxError() ) );
// returns '[object Error]'

console.log( specificationClass( new URIError() ) );
// returns '[object Error]'

console.log( specificationClass( new RangeError() ) );
// returns '[object Error]'

console.log( specificationClass( new ReferenceError() ) );
// returns '[object Error]'

console.log( specificationClass( new EvalError() ) );
// returns '[object Error]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Int8Array() ) );
// returns '[object Int8Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Uint8Array() ) );
// returns '[object Uint8Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Uint8ClampedArray() ) );
// returns '[object Uint8ClampedArray]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Int16Array() ) );
// returns '[object Int16Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Uint16Array() ) );
// returns '[object Uint16Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Int32Array() ) );
// returns '[object Int32Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Uint32Array() ) );
// returns '[object Uint32Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Float32Array() ) );
// returns '[object Float32Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new Float64Array() ) );
// returns '[object Float64Array]'

console.log( specificationClass( new ArrayBuffer() ) );
// returns '[object ArrayBuffer]'

console.log( specificationClass( Math ) );
// returns '[object Math]'

console.log( specificationClass( JSON ) );
// returns '[object JSON]'

function Person(){}
console.log( specificationClass( new Person() ) );
// returns '[object Object]'
```
<!-- </examples> -->

<!-- <links> -->
[object-to-string]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/toString
<!-- </links> -->
